summary:
The Empire State Building is a famous skyscraper in New York City, with 102 stories. It was built in 1931 and got its name from New York's nickname, "The Empire State." At 1,454 feet tall, it was the world's tallest building for almost 40 years.

The building's design changed many times to ensure it would be the tallest. It's now the city's seventh-tallest building but remains a popular tourist attraction. People can visit observation decks on the 86th and 102nd floors. It's also known for its appearance in movies and TV shows.
title: Empire State Building
